p.s: During the scene the relationship between Abe and Amir develops a lot.
At the beginning of the scene Abe tries to explain to Amir what the situation and the problem is.
Amir listens to his nephew and only asks to understandsunderstand him better for example in line 2 What about it?, line 5 You laughed? or line 9 What are they doing?.
Amir seems a bit skepticalsceptical after Abe told him what the issue is, what he recognizes and asks his uncle if he believes him (e.g. line 13).
As ana reaction Amir calls Ken and shows Abe that he want'swants to help him by saying it is urgent (e.g. line 20).
Abe is still worried and asks his uncle what he would do if he were in his situation, but Amir just responses that we are not there to talk about that yet (e.g. line 29).
In the beginning of the scene Amir really tries to help his nephew who is obviously worried and does not now what to do.
Furthermore it gets more and more complicated in their relationship.
They start talking about if it would have been better if their fathers would have never come to the USA.
They start arguing until Abe explodes and says that Amir does not have a better life here, knows he got fired and knows what he did to his wife Emily (e.g. line 48 and 50).
Amir only responds with silent I don't know (e.g. line 52).
The situation wentswent downhill when they start a discussion about Abe's behavior in the society.
Amir is triggered about what Abe says about his background and that he forgot who he really is (e.g. line 51).
In AmirsAmir's opinion Abe is the one who forgot that, who changed his name twice and is completlycompletely unsure how to deal with his background and religion.
Both start to interrupt each other and Abe is completlycompletely confronting him about his behavior regarding the people he loves and that he used to look up to him (e.g. line 65, 66).
Abe feels like his uncle let him down even though Amir tried to help him in the beginning of the scene, that is why Abe leaves and want'swants to handle it himself.
Both of them have problems with their religious background and with their identity that was the reason why their conversation escalated at the end of the scene.
They started to argue about American authorities, which both try to fullfillfulfill by changing their names and completlycompletely fading into American stereotypes regarding behavior and appearance.

It is a difficult topic for both of them because they had to deal with challenges their whole life, that is why the conversation developed the way it did from Amir who tried to help his nephew out of this complicated and stressfullstressful situation into a very personal and intense discussion with no helpful ending for their relationship.
Amir thinks that Abe's behavior is ridiculous and the way how he tries to fit into the society without lying about his roots.

It is not understandable for Amir because he always tries to fit in by completlycompletely avoiding to talk about where he comes from which didn't work out that well for his personal feelings but also for the relationships to his closest people.
